page.title: 19BEAM ENGINES POOL,CAMBORNE
page.content: The{East Pool Whim}and{Pumping Engine are{N.T. properties}on the A.30.The name 'Whim'comes from 'Whimsy',a term for a winding engine.This engine was used in East Pool Mine to{transport {miners and ore}from depths of 1300 feet.It was designed by{F.W.Michell in{1887}and built by the{Holman {Brothers.}The shaft it worked on collasped due to earth movements and the Engine's work ended.It is in operation today after being{restored in{1941}but is run by an electric motor.Nearby is the East Pool{Pumping {Engine.}It is the{largest and newest in Cornwall.It was designed by {N.Trestrail}and built by{Harvey and {Co. of Hayle.}It worked from{1892 to {1854.}It was saved by G.Bath a famous engineering historian.
